trans-unit.source: The data in your Microsoft Azure storage account is always replicated to ensure durability and high availability, meeting the <link><linkText>Azure Storage SLA</linkText><title></title></link> even in the face of transient hardware failures.
trans-unit.target: The data in your Microsoft Azure storage account is always replicated to ensure durability and high availability, meeting the <link><linkText>Azure Storage SLA</linkText><title></title></link> even in the face of transient hardware failures.

trans-unit.source: When you create a storage account, you must select one of the following replication options:
trans-unit.target: When you create a storage account, you must select one of the following replication options:

trans-unit.source: Locally redundant storage (LRS). Locally redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.
trans-unit.target: Locally redundant storage (LRS). Locally redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.

trans-unit.source: LRS is replicated three times within a single facility in a single region.
trans-unit.target: LRS is replicated three times within a single facility in a single region.

trans-unit.source: LRS protects your data from normal hardware failures, but not from the failure of a single facility.
trans-unit.target: LRS protects your data from normal hardware failures, but not from the failure of a single facility.

trans-unit.source: LRS is offered at a discount.
trans-unit.target: LRS is offered at a discount.

trans-unit.source: For maximum durability, we recommend that you use geo-redundant storage, described below.
trans-unit.target: For maximum durability, we recommend that you use geo-redundant storage, described below.

trans-unit.source: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS). Zone-redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.
trans-unit.target: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS). Zone-redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.

trans-unit.source: ZRS is replicated three times across two to three facilities, either within a single region or across two regions, providing higher durability than LRS.
trans-unit.target: ZRS is replicated three times across two to three facilities, either within a single region or across two regions, providing higher durability than LRS.

trans-unit.source: ZRS ensures that your data is durable within a single region.
trans-unit.target: ZRS ensures that your data is durable within a single region.

trans-unit.source: ZRS provides a higher level of durability than LRS; however, for maximum durability, we recommend that you use geo-redundant storage, described below.
trans-unit.target: ZRS provides a higher level of durability than LRS; however, for maximum durability, we recommend that you use geo-redundant storage, described below.

trans-unit.source: ZRS is currently available only for block blobs.
trans-unit.target: ZRS is currently available only for block blobs.

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your storage account and selected ZRS, you cannot convert it to use to any other type of replication, or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your storage account and selected ZRS, you cannot convert it to use to any other type of replication, or vice versa.

trans-unit.source: Geo-redundant storage (GRS).
trans-unit.target: Geo-redundant storage (GRS).

trans-unit.source: Geo-redundant storage is enabled for your storage account by default when you create it.
trans-unit.target: Geo-redundant storage is enabled for your storage account by default when you create it.

trans-unit.source: GRS maintains six copies of your data.
trans-unit.target: GRS maintains six copies of your data.

trans-unit.source: With GRS, your data is replicated three times within the primary region, and is also replicated three times in a secondary region hundreds of miles away from the primary region, providing the highest level of durability.
trans-unit.target: With GRS, your data is replicated three times within the primary region, and is also replicated three times in a secondary region hundreds of miles away from the primary region, providing the highest level of durability.

trans-unit.source: In the event of a failure at the primary region, Azure Storage will failover to the secondary region.
trans-unit.target: In the event of a failure at the primary region, Azure Storage will failover to the secondary region.

trans-unit.source: GRS ensures that your data is durable in two separate regions.
trans-unit.target: GRS ensures that your data is durable in two separate regions.

trans-unit.source: Read access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS).
trans-unit.target: Read access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS).

trans-unit.source: Read access geo-redundant storage replicates your data to a secondary geographic location, and also provides read access to your data in the secondary location.
trans-unit.target: Read access geo-redundant storage replicates your data to a secondary geographic location, and also provides read access to your data in the secondary location.

trans-unit.source: Read-access geo-redundant storage allows you to access your data from either the primary or the secondary location, in the event that one location becomes unavailable.
trans-unit.target: Read-access geo-redundant storage allows you to access your data from either the primary or the secondary location, in the event that one location becomes unavailable.

trans-unit.source: You can change how your data is replicated after your storage account has been created, unless you specified ZRS when you created the account.
trans-unit.target: You can change how your data is replicated after your storage account has been created, unless you specified ZRS when you created the account.

trans-unit.source: However, note that you may incur an additional one-time data transfer cost if you switch from LRS to GRS or RA-GRS.
trans-unit.target: However, note that you may incur an additional one-time data transfer cost if you switch from LRS to GRS or RA-GRS.
